subject: Programming
title: Binary Search
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Binary Search.

hook.text: Open a dictionary to the middle. Is your word before or after? You just cut the search in half.

buildup.text: Binary search splits a sorted list in half with each step, eliminating half the options.

discovery.text: It runs in O(log n). A billion items take just 30 comparisons instead of a billion.

twist.text: The catch: the list must be sorted first. Without order, binary search can't work.

climax.text: Every time you search Google or look up a contact, a form of binary search is at work.

punchline.text: Cut the problem in half, thirty times, done.

quiz.question: How many comparisons does binary search need for a billion items?
